text: By the way, I was wondering: is there some way to get a julia "expert" to review my code (can be a paid deal, obviously) and give hints where it's dumb, or no optimized, etc?

elements.text: By the way, I was wondering: is there some way to get a julia "expert" to review my code (can be a paid deal, obviously) and give hints where it's dumb, or no optimized, etc?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Post it on the internet as "the best way to do it", and you'll soon find top tier developers earning in the top tax brackets deciphering your code for free. That is the Cunningham's Law! :P

elements.text: Post it on the internet as "the best way to do it", and you'll soon find top tier developers earning in the top tax brackets deciphering your code for free. That is the Cunningham's Law! :P

text: or post it as "slower than python/matlab"

elements.text: or post it as "slower than python/matlab"

text: Yeah… the thing is, there are a few things that are not obvious from the start and end up having a huge impact on performance it seems. It would be good to have a knowledgeable eye to quickly catch those bad parts

elements.text: Yeah… the thing is, there are a few things that are not obvious from the start and end up having a huge impact on performance it seems. It would be good to have a knowledgeable eye to quickly catch those bad parts
